https://electrek.co/2025/05/01/tesla-tsl.title: Tesla (TSLA) reveals web of transactions between Elon Musk ... - Electrek
https://electrek.co/2025/05/01/tesla-tsl.content: Tesla (TSLA) reveals web of transactions between Elon Musk's companies | Electrek Tesla (TSLA) reveals web of transactions between Elon Musk’s companies Tesla (TSLA) has revealed the latest web of transactions between itself, Elon Musk, his multiple companies, and board members. xAI is the latest private Musk company that Tesla’s CEO is pushing to work with Tesla. Tesla also disclosed paying The Boring Company (TBC), a company privately owned by Musk, over $3 million in 2024 and $800,000 in the first two months of 2025: Tesla incurred expenses of approximately $2.8 million for such security services in 2024 and approximately $0.5 million through February 2025, representing a portion of the total cost of security services concerning Elon Musk.

https://evmagazine.com/fleet-and-commerc.title: Top 10: EV Partnerships | EV Magazine
https://evmagazine.com/fleet-and-commerc.content: They announced a partnership to establish a joint venture company focused on researching and developing battery electric vehicles (BEVs), combining BYD's strengths in EV development and competitiveness with Toyota's quality and safety technology. The two companies plan to establish a joint venture with a US$5bn investment to build an EV battery cell production plant in Bartow County, Georgia. The facility, set to begin operations in the second half of 2025, will have an annual production capacity of 35 GWh, sufficient to support 300,000 EVs. This strategic collaboration aims to secure a stable battery supply for Hyundai's US manufacturing facilities, accelerating the Group's electrification efforts. Stellantis and Samsung SDI have formed a significant partnership to bolster EV battery production in the US.

https://www.punenow.com/tesla-to-acquire.content: According to the official, Tesla has been searching for a dependable and accountable real estate agent in India for over a year to facilitate land acquisition for this plant. When contacted, Tesla Inc., Tesla India, the Ministry of Heavy Industries, and the Maharashtra government did not respond to media quieries.
